alert.note: Alert for Litchfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 16 at 10:42AM EDT until July 19 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Housatonic River At Gaylordsville. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, The water reaches businesses on the low side of Spring Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 9.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.1 feet on 04/03/1970. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Housatonic River Gaylordsville Flood Stage: 8.0 Observed Stage at Sun 10 am: 7.1 Forecast: Sun 2 pm 7.5 Sun 8 pm 8.6 Mon 2 am 9.1 Mon 8 am 9.1 Mon 2 pm 8.9 Mon 8 pm 8.7 Tue 2 am 8.5 Tue 8 am 8.3 Tue 2 pm 8.1 Tue 8 pm 8.0 Wed 2 am 7.8 &&
